original_title: Bus accident in Turkey injures 27 Sri Lankans
original_body_lines: Twenty-seven Sri Lankan individuals were injured in a bus accident in Turkey.
The incident occurred when a bus carrying 39 Sri Lankans, who are working on a project at Istanbul Airport, overturned.
The driver lost control of the bus, causing it to veer off the road and tumble down a 6-meter cliff.
The injured passengers were promptly taken to the hospital for medical treatment.
Meanwhile, the Sri Lankan diplomatic mission in Turkey has announced that an embassy representative will be sent to assist the affected group.
